text: Kim Dae-jungKim Dae Jung ; Hanja 金大中 (6 January 1924 - 18 August 2009) was a South Korean president. In 2000, he got the Nobel Peace Prize. He is the first person from Korea to get a Nobel prize.Kim Dae-Jung (Short Asian Week biography) A Roman Catholic since 1957, he has been called the "Nelson Mandela" of Asia Kim Dae-Jung (Short CNN biography) Kim Dae Jung was the President (succeeding Kim Young-sam) from 1998 to 2003. He was born in Haui- do, South Jeolla Province, an island off the South Korean Coast in 1924. Kim died on 18 August 2009 at a hospital in Seoul from cardiac arrest caused by multiple organ failure and pneumonia, aged 85. ==Related pages == * List of Nobel Prize winners by country ==References== == Other websites == * Official Nobel page for Kim * Kim Dae-jung Presidential Library * BBC article on his legacy Category:1924 births Category:Presidents of South Korea Category:Roman Catholics Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:2009 deaths Category:Deaths from cardiac arrest Category:Deaths from pneumonia
title: Kim Dae-jung
